alert.note: Alert for Logan; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:01PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Wichita and southwestern Logan Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 500 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southwest of Russell Springs, or 21 miles north of Leoti, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Wichita and southwestern Logan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland. Landspout tornadoes can form with a developing thunderstorm before rain, hail, and even thunder is observed. Landspout tornadoes are not usually associated with a wall cloud and are often difficult to detect with weather radar. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for west central Kansas.
